data.stimulus:
One of the characteristics of the report is its LAYOUT.

 

► Look at the texts below: one of them is a report and the other is an essay.

 
Which one is the report?
Label the report features in the picture below (drag and drop).

Let's outline some of the characteristics of reports.

Match the beginnings with the ends of the sentences (drag and drop).
data.template:
1. Using the correct layout will make it clear that {{response}}.
  2. Divide your report into sections  {{response}}.
  3. Use headings in every section. {{response}}.
  4. Use bullet points in the recommendations section. This will help your reader {{response}}.  
  5.  Use {{response}} style.

stems:
a)     Reports don't need an introduction
b)     Reports normally use personal language (I, we, …)
c)     Reports normally include recommendations.
d)     Reports need to include factual information.
e)     You should not use headings.
data.stimulus: Are following statements TRUE or FALSE about academic reports?

possible_responses: suggesting ways in which it could be improved

value: suggesting ways in which it could be improved

data.stimulus:
You are going to read an example report.

In this report, the section headings are missing. 

► Choose the correct headings from the drop down.

 

Waste Reduction at Coventry University London
data.template:
{{response}}

The purpose of this report is to suggest ways in which Coventry University London can use resources more carefully and reduce wastage. I will suggest a range of measures to achieve this.

{{response}}

The University currently uses twice as much printing paper as it did two years ago. This is despite the fact that information is stored on computers. Any unnecessary use of paper affects the environment in two ways: firstly, by using valuable resources and secondly by posing a waste removal problem. I would suggest that in future no documents should be printed unless there is a good reason for doing so and students should be required to submit assignments electronically.

{{response}}

Currently, many lights, heaters and computers are not turned off when no one is in the building. Televisions and other electronic equipment are left on stand-by overnight, adding to the University electricity consumption. Students and staff should be reminded to turn off the lights and equipment when they are not in use.

{{response}}

A significant number of students and staff come to University by car or motorbike. This adds to our energy consumption. I recommend that the University stops offering free parking on site and encourages students and staff to use public transport or other environmentally friendly forms of transportation such as bikes, if possible. In addition to this, staff might consider working from home at least two days per week.

{{response}}

Research suggests that if we implement all the suggested measures, the university would be able to reduce wastage by 20% every year.

data.stimulus:
► Answer the questions below about the example report.

 

1. According to the writer, which problems does unnecessary use of paper cause? (choose TWO)

► Read the report carefully: You only have ONE check answer attempt!

2. According to the writer, how can the university save electricity?

► Read the report carefully: You only have ONE check answer attempt!

options.label: Work from home at least twice a week.
Charge to use the car park.
Encourage staff to use public transport.

data.stimulus:
3. What does the writer suggest to reduce travel-related energy waste? (choose FOUR)

► Read the report carefully: You only have ONE check answer attempt!

possible_responses: The writer followed all the guidelines.
The writer didn't follow the guidelines.
The writer followed most of the guidelines.
The report should have a title
data.stimulus:
Critical Thinking 

► Look at the example report again and consider what you learned in this lesson so far.
data.template:
1. Is the report clearly organised? {{response}}
  2. Did the writer follow the guidelines on page 3 (item 3) of this lesson? {{response}}
  3. How can the report be improved? {{response}}

value: The writer followed all the guidelines.

data.stimulus:
Read the second and third section of the report again.

► Highlight the sentences which use the passive.

 

Section Two - Paper
data.template: The University currently uses twice as much printing paper as it did two years ago. This is despite the fact that information is stored on computers. Any unnecessary use of paper affects the environment in two ways: firstly, by using valuable resources and secondly by posing a waste removal problem. I would suggest that in future no documents should be printed unless there is a good reason for doing so and students should be required to submit assignments electronically.

Currently, many lights, heaters and computers are not turned off when no one is in the building. Televisions and other electronic equipment are left on stand-by overnight . This adds to the University electricity consumption. Students and staff should be reminded to turn off the lights and equipment when they are not in use.

options.label: A range of measures will be suggested to achieve this
A range of measures I will suggest to achieve this
A range of measures will be suggesting to achieve this
A range of measures were suggesting to achieve this

data.stimulus:
There are two sentences in the report which use personal language.

The writer should have used the passive to make the report more formal.

 

 

 ► Let's change these sentences into the passive: 

 

1. I will suggest a range of measures to achieve this.

options.label: If all the suggested measures are implemented, ...
If all the suggested measures we implement, ...
If all the suggested measures is implemented, ...
If all the suggested measures are implementing, ...

data.stimulus: 2. If we implement all the suggested measures, ...
